description.narrative: The project objective is to increase the resilience of Ethiopian pastoralists to external shocks and to improve the livelihoods of targeted communities.

condition.narrative: An internal auditor shall have been recruited to the RPCUs of the Somali and Afar Regions not latter than 180 days following theeffectivenss date.
government counterpart contribution in the amount od US$1 mil is deposited in nthe project account by October 15, 08 each projectyear.
not later than 60 days after effective, an MOU is signed b/n FPCU and FCA for the management of the rural livelihoodsprogramxecuted between the Federal Cooperatives Agency(FCA) and t
not later than 60 days following the Effective Date, the Recipient shall ensurethat a MOU for the mang't the PEW and Responseprogram has been signed

comment.narrative: This represents 23% of the beneficiaries.
As a new initiative, the baseline value is zero
406 or 35% more than the target.Out of the 448 PaSACCOS established, 406 have active loan accounts
Out of the 449 PaSACCOs 293 have active bank accounts.

title.narrative: Approved (budgeted) DPSIP sub projects completed each year

comment.narrative: New activity and hence baseline value is zero
89 and exceeds the targetOut of the 181 planned DPSIP sub-projects 162 are completed at the end of the project life.

title.narrative: Percent of PaSACCOs established that are offering credit services two years after establishment

comment.narrative: New initiative and the baseline value is zero
100. All the 318 PaSACCOs established before two years are still providing the credit services.
100% (All PaSACCOs are providing credit)

title.narrative: Community based disaster preparedness infrastructure investments that are operational and have maintenance plans (Comp 2b.)

comment.narrative: New investment initiated by PCDP and hence the baseline value is zero
100 exceeds the target.All the 162 completed sub-projects are operational and have maintenance plans
Data to be compiled at the end of the FY
Since community consultation in the selected project site is new, the baseline is taken as zero.
1,186,984 or 42% women in project area
This represents 49% of the total participants

title.narrative: Men and women participating in consultation activities that take place as part of project implementation (Comp 1a)

comment.narrative: Since community consultation in the selected project site is new, the baseline is taken as zero.
2.86 million. This represents 45% of the total target population
This represents 54% of the total target population.

title.narrative: People with improved access to potable water sub-projects

comment.narrative: This PDO indicator was formulated as part of the June 2011 MTR restructuring of the project and hence base line value as outcomelevel indicator is taken as zero.
1,100,672 people (of which about 51% of them are women) or more than 6 fold compared to the target, now have improved accessto potable water.
Data will be compiled as part of the end of project evaluation survey scheduled for October 2013. To date 273 water relatedsub-projects are serving 474316 people.

title.narrative: People with access to improved rual roads sub-projects

comment.narrative: This PDO indicator was formulated as part of the June 2011 MTR restructuring of the project and hence base line value as outcomelevel indicator is taken as zero.
365,000 people or more that 80% of the target benefited from the 1394 km community roads constructed under the project
Data will be compiled as part of the end of project evaluation survey scheduled for October 2013.

title.narrative: Households with improved access to small scale irrigation sub-projects

comment.narrative: This PDO indicator was formulated as part of the June 2011 MTR restructuring of the project and hence base line value as outcomelevel indicator is taken as zero.
42,047 households, exceeds the target by more than three fold. Beneficiaries cultivated 3468 hectares
Data will be compiled as part of the end of project evaluation survey scheduled for October 2013.

title.narrative: People with increased access to health services provided by the PCDP constructed facilities

comment.narrative: This PDO indicator was formulated as part of the June 2011 MTR restructuring of the project and hence base line value as outcomelevel indicator is taken as zero.
A total of 757,648 people (of which 48% of them are women) or 68% more than the target have access to health services
During the reporting period a total of 376,438 people (of which 50% of them are women) have access to health services

title.narrative: Students enrolled (grade 1-8) in PCDP constructed school sub-projects per year (% girls)

comment.narrative: This PDO indicator was formulated as part of the June 2011 MTR restructuring of the project and hence base line value as outcomelevel indicator is taken as zero.
43 or 95.5% of the target achieved. Out of the total 73,784 students enrolled, 31,704 (43%) are girls
Out of the total 49,477 students enrolled during the reporting period, some 22012 or 44% are girls

title.narrative: Number of Livestock benefiting from increased access to health facilities sub-projects

comment.narrative: This PDO indicator was formulated as part of the June 2011 MTR restructuring of the project and hence base line value as outcomelevel indicator is taken as zero.
2.3 million livestock have access to veterinary services. The 363 vet centers are benefiting 398,378 Households of which 47% ofthem are women headed.
The project reported that some 1.6 million livestock have access to veterinary services owned by some 327,006 households ofwhich about 51% of them are women headed

title.narrative: DER Grants-financed early response activities within one month after request is officially submitted up on pastoral area EWS identifying change from “normal” conditions

comment.narrative: This PDO indicator was formulated as part of the June 2011 MTR restructuring of the project and since DER grants are newinitiatives under PCDP II, the base line value is taken as zero.
100. There were requests from the four regions and in all cases proper response were made with in a month period of time afterofficial requests were made.
Request was submitted only from Afar Region and accordingly, ETB 1.245 million has been transferred within a month time

title.narrative: PaSACCOs members with active savings accounts (% female)

comment.narrative: This PDO indicator was formulated as part of the June 2011 MTR restructuring of the project and since interventions in PaSACCO wasa new initiative, the base line value is taken as zero.
79. out of 22,422 eligible PaSACCOs members 15,193(79%) are female members who have active loan accounts
Out of the 20788 members with active loan accounts 13734 (66%) are female

title.narrative: PaSACCOs members with active savings accounts (% total)

comment.narrative: This PDO indicator was formulated as part of the June 2011 MTR restructuring of the project and since interventions in PaSACCO wasa new initiative, the base line value taken as zero.
78. out of 28901 eligible PaSACCOs members 22,422 (78%) members have accessed loans
Out of the total 28467 PaSACCOs members 20788 have active saving accounts.

title.narrative: Early warning monthly and quarterly reports produced and disseminated (national and regional) (Comp 2a.)

comment.narrative: 100 and exceeds the target.All the planned Early Warning Monthly and Quarterly reports were produced and disseminated
The project has been successful in this area.

title.narrative: Sub-projects completed that receive recurrent costs associated with PCDP CIF social investments

comment.narrative: During the reporting period out of 202 sub-projects 166 (82 %) are operational. To date out of 2021 completed CIF sub projects1874are functional and have maintenance arrangements due to the allocation of recurrent costs.
99.To date out of the 2682 planned sub-projects 2,655 sub-projects were completed
During the reporting period out of the 311 planned sub-projects 202 (65%) were completed. To date out of the planned 2258sub-projects , 2021 were completed during the 2011/12 FY
